greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime q such that (p^q+1)/(p+1) is a prime, where p = prime(n).
comment: It is known that for the prime 97, a(25) > 31000. - _T. D. Noe_, Feb 13 2004
link: H. Dubner and T. Granlund, Primes of the Form (b^n+1)/(b+1), J. Integer Sequences, 3 (2000), #P00.2.7.
mathematica: Do[p = Prime[n]; k = 1; While[ !PrimeQ[ (p^Prime[k] + 1)/(p + 1)], k++ ]; Print[ Prime[k]], {n, 1, 15} ]
xref: Cf. A084742 (least k such that (n^k+1)/(n+1) is prime).
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 26 2001
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Jan 22 2004
